answers.answer: People fleeing the war in Ukraine and those in special situations who come from this country can receive medical assistance under the Romanian social health insurance system, which covers basic services such as medical care, medications, and medical equipment. Additionally, they have access to other benefits, including exemptions from certain contributions and co-payments. In specific cases, they may also receive specialized ambulatory medical assistance without needing a referral ticket.
answers.bResponse: People fleeing the war in Ukraine and those in special situations who come from this country can receive medical assistance under the Romanian social health insurance system, which covers basic services such as medical care, medications, and medical equipment. Additionally, they have access to other benefits, including exemptions from certain contributions and co-payments. In specific cases, they may also receive specialized ambulatory medical assistance without needing a referral ticket. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine

answers.answer: Medical services in specialized ambulatory medical assistance for the clinical specialties included in the basic service package.
answers.bResponse: Medical services in specialized ambulatory medical assistance for the clinical specialties included in the basic service package. For more details, visit https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine

answers.answer: No, there are no restrictions mentioned in the summary when it comes to medications available to those benefiting from the social health insurance system. The individuals receiving benefits under this system have access to various types of medicines, sanitary materials, medical devices, and medical services, including those provided through the national curative health programs.
